speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing along with the neck swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any other symptoms. No fever, no pain, and no discharge from the swelling. Overall, I feel healthy otherwise.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent infections, such as a cold or sore throat, prior to the swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses. Just the swelling on my neck has been concerning me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your weight, appetite, or energy levels recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant changes in my weight or appetite. My energy levels feel normal as well.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent dental work or issues with your teeth?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent dental work or issues with my teeth. Everything seems fine in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any difficulty swallowing or breathing due to the swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any difficulty swallowing or breathing. The swelling hasn't affected those functions at all.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any allergies or reactions to medications or foods in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any known allergies or reactions to medications or foods in the past. I've tolerated my medications well.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you traveled anywhere recently or been exposed to anyone who has been ill?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled anywhere recently, and I haven't been in close contact with anyone who has been ill. Just the usual routine for me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin, such as rashes or discoloration, around the swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my skin around the swelling. No rashes or discoloration, just the swelling itself.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any history of thyroid problems or any family history of thyroid disease?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any personal history of thyroid problems, and there's no known family history of thyroid disease either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any hoarseness or changes in your voice recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any hoarseness or changes in my voice. My voice has been normal throughout this time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any lumps or swellings in other areas of your body?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any lumps or swellings in other areas of my body. The swelling on my neck is the only one I've observed.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or immunizations?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations or immunizations. Just the usual ones I keep up with.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any night sweats or unexplained fatigue recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any night sweats or unexplained fatigue. I feel pretty much the same as usual.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your environment, such as new pets, plants, or exposure to chemicals?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent changes in my environment. No new pets, plants, or exposure to chemicals that I can think of. Everything has been pretty much the same.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your voice or difficulty swallowing?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my voice or difficulty swallowing. Everything feels normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests or imaging studies done for this swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent blood tests or imaging studies done for the swelling. I was hoping to get some answers during this visit.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Neck_Ultrasound. Let's start with an ultrasound of your neck to get a better look at the swelling and determine its characteristics. This will help us understand what might be causing it.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Well-circumscribed lesion in the subcutaneous tissue suggestive of a cystic nature.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on the ultrasound results indicating a well-circumscribed lesion suggestive of a cystic nature, have you ever had any similar swellings or cysts in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any similar swellings or cysts in the past. This is the first time I've experienced something like this.

speaker: Doctor
text: Given that this is your first experience with a swelling like this, have you noticed any changes in the size of the swelling since it first appeared?

speaker: Patient
text: The swelling has been progressively increasing since it first appeared two months ago. It seems to be getting larger, but I haven't measured it or anything.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on the information you've provided, including the ultrasound results and the progressive increase in size of the swelling, it appears that you may have a benign cyst, possibly a sebaceous cyst or a lymphatic cyst. However, further evaluation may be needed to confirm this. DIAGNOSIS READY: Benign cyst (likely sebaceous or lymphatic cyst).

speaker: Patient
text: What are the next steps for me regarding this cyst? Will it require treatment or monitoring?

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I'm open to whatever you recommend. If it needs treatment, I'm ready to discuss options, but if monitoring is sufficient, I can do that too. What do you suggest?
